    • Field Detail

      • edgePanRules

        public com.spartanlaboratories.engine.structure.StandardCamera.EdgePanRules edgePanRules

      • worldLocation

        public Location worldLocation
        A Location that designates the center of this StandardCamera's point of view in the "real" world

      • monitorLocation

        public Location monitorLocation
        A Location that designates where the center viewpoint of this camera is located on the monitor.

      • dimensions

        public Location dimensions
        A Location that stores how far away from the worldLocation objects can be seen by this StandardCamera. The x coordinate represents the total width of view of the StandardCamera and the y coordinate represents the total height of view of the StandardCamera. So if this Location's coordinates are (x,y) then the camera will be able to see objects that are x/2 to the right or left of the worldLocation and y/2 up or down from the worldLocation. When a camera is created the dimensions location is set to the resolution of the monitor (unless a custom display size was specified) and it is usually better to be left that way unless a single display is being used to render the view of multiple Cameras.
        See Also:
        monitorLocation

        The StandardCamera Constructor

        Creates a camera at the specified location and creates default location values

        Parameters:

        worldLocation - the location in the "real" world at which the camera is located

      • getCameraSpeed

        public int getCameraSpeed()

        Returns:

      • canSeeObject

        public boolean canSeeObject(VisibleObject vo)
        Checks whether the camera is able to see the given object. Identical to withinBounds(VisibleObject).
        Parameters:
        vo - - The Visible Object the visibility of which is being tested
        Returns:
        a boolean value which represents the object's visibility

      • fullyWithinBounds

        public boolean fullyWithinBounds(VisibleObject vo)
        Returns whether or not the parameter is completely covered by the view of this camera.
        Parameters:
        vo - - The parameter the visibility of which is being tested.
        Returns:
        true if all of the passed in visible object is visible.
        false if any part of the passed in visible object is not visible.

      • withinBounds

        public boolean withinBounds(VisibleObject vo)
        Checks if any part of the passed in object is within the bounds of this camera. Should be identical in functionality to canSeeObject(VisibleObject). The difference is this method uses the parameter's location on screen rather than the real world location. This method provides an alternate way of checking the visibility of an object and should be used in case the algorith in canSeeObject(VisibleObject) is broken.
        Parameters:
        vo - - The VisibleObject whose presence within the borders of this camera is being tested.
        Returns:
        - A boolean value that represents whether or not this the passed in object is within borders.
